zone.line: (ult.)
peculiarity of the moral & intellectual
condition of the minds among which
they have been produced. Thus a
number of writers have the form , whilst
they want the spirit of those whom,
it is alledged, they imitate, because
the former is the endowment of the
age in which they live, & the latter
must be the uncommunicated
lightning of their own mind. ˜˜˜˜
The mass of capabilities ins remains at every
period materially the same; the circum
stances which awaken it to action
perpetually change. If England were
divided into forty republics each
æqual in population & extent to
Athens, there is every no reason to
suppose but that, under institutions
æqually no more ex perfect than
those of Athens, each would produce
philosophers & poets equal to those
who (if we except Shakespeare) have
